Package commands.requirements.validators

Interface Validator<I,O>

All Known Implementing Classes:
Misc.GreaterValidator, Misc.LowerValidator, Misc.NotNullValidator, Misc.OrNullValidator, Validator.ChainValidator
Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public interface Validator<I,O>
Functional interface for validation and converting requirements values. You can also combine validators using the and(Validator) method.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    static class 
    Validator.ChainValidator<K,L,M>
    Internal class that helps aggregate two validators in one.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default <M> Validator<I,M>
    and(Validator<O,M> mixinValidator)
    Return Validator.ChainValidator that includes the current and additional validation rules.
    O
    validate(I value)
    Validate value.

  • Method Details

    • validate

      O validate(I value) throws ValidationError
      Validate value. If valid, return value of type. Except throws ValidationError.
      Parameters:
      value - - value to validate.
      Returns:
      validated value of type.
      Throws:
      ValidationError - if the value is invalid.

    • and

      default <M> Validator<I,M> and(Validator<O,M> mixinValidator)
      Return Validator.ChainValidator that includes the current and additional validation rules. Can be used as a chain of validators like validator1.and(new Validator2()).and(new Validator3()).and(new NotNullValidator()).
      Parameters:
      mixinValidator - - additional validator to add to the chain.
      Returns:
      a Validator.ChainValidator containing the current and additional validation rules.
